snippet: The White House pushed back against criticism from conservative lawmakers who said the suspected leader of the 2012 Benghazi attack should be tried by the military.
abstract: Conservative lawmakers criticize Obama administration’s decision to prosecute Ahmed Abu Khattala, suspected leader of the 2012 attack in Benghazi, Libya, in the civilian criminal justice system, arguing that he should be questioned and tried by the military.

byline.original: By JENNIFER STEINHAUER and CHARLIE SAVAGE

lead_paragraph: The White House pushed back against criticism from conservative lawmakers who said the suspected leader of the 2012 Benghazi attack should be tried by the military.

headline.main: U.S. Defends Prosecuting Benghazi Suspect in Civilian Rather Than Military Court
headline.print_headline: U.S. Defends Prosecuting Benghazi Suspect in Civilian Rather Than Military Court
